reviews.review: Un juegazo de Valve, acción mezclada con suspenso, además de exelentes puzzles hacen de Portal un juego alternativo a los FPS tradicionales. Mediante el uso de un arma que crea portales, debemos recorrer y encontrar la salida de los laboratorios de "Aperture Science", bajo el ojo que todo lo ve de nuestra supervisora, una IA dispuesta a experimentar con nosotros hasta que decida que ya no necesita experimentar más.
Awesome game! Normally im not a fan of puzzles but its the comedy put into the game that makes it what it is. You should play this before you play the second.

You play as a girl using a gun that doesn't kill people, and you get promised diabetes if you beat a bunch of science stuff. It's kinda fun.

Excellent puzzler with a great story line and sense of humour. Core game is not that difficult, but advanced maps and a big modding community provide the longevity.
that one game about the cake

Love this series. Simple yet complex. Accesable yet challenging. Humorous with a dark mystery lingering at all times. Following a basic "use portals to get around" format, you'll solve puzzles in a pristine testing ficility while being instructed by the hillariously cruel Glados. You'll laugh, become interested in the mystery of the company, and even grow scared when things aren't as they seem. Plus, it's set in the Half Life universe adding another layer of plot. This game is quite short, but in a way that leads to multiple playthroughs. There are also many bonus challenges.This game is tweaked to perfection, and truely unforgettable.
This is a wonderful stratagy game. It alows you to think, but it is very fun and i think anyone would enjoy this game!

Ну что тут сказать... Лучшей игры в этом жанре я не видел. Valve опять создали шедевр!

I feel the need to re-review this game because my previous review (for lack of better terminology) sucked, and this game deserves better.  Portal was originally included as an experimental side game in The Orange Box, alongside Team Fortress 2 and Half-Life 2 Episodes 1 and 2, but wound up shining just as brightly for being a solid game that used it's concepts to the fullest.

Portal is a First-Person Puzzle game where you utilize a device that can create direct links between two surfaces.  There are other mechanics as well, and the game tests your ability to use these "portals" to solve puzzles.

What strikes me the most about this game and it's sequel is how much attention went into level design.  The developer commentary details that the playtesting process was quite rigorous to ensure the game was still challenging, while not becoming frustrating, which is a very delicate balance to achieve.

The sound effects are satisfying, and the ambient music does a good job of providing a sense of eerieness and sterility to the environments.  I don't think I have to mention Still Alive by Jonathan Coulton, but I will anyway.  Ellen McLain does a wonderful job in the role of the facility's AI supervisor GLaDOS as well as certain obstacles you encounter.

Portal is a game that holds up remarkably well.  While I'd say the sequel has more value (endless user created levels will do that for ya), this game is a very tight, cohesive experience that I feel should be a staple in anyone's Steam Library.
I think I am in love.

Began life as a simple stocking stuffer for The Orange Box, but so much love and creativity was put into this game, it's now LEGENDARY.
(Reviewer "Yahtzee" Croshaw, infamous for ragging on pretty much all games he reviews, COULDN'T say ANYTHING bad about PORTAL.)
If you have not heard of Portal or played the game. Do it! Then you buy Portal 2. You most likely will not be disapointed.

I believe Yahtzee (Zero Punctuation) said: "Absolutely sublime from start to finish and I will jam forks into my eyes if I ever use those words to describe anything else, ever again. Yeah, I know it's not very funny to like a game, but f*** you. Portal is great and if you don't think so then you must be stupid."
I couldn't agree more.
It's deemed it a classic for a reason. Just as good a decade after its release as it was on launch.

Valve coge el tan resobado género de los "first person shooter" y en un par de vueltas de tuerca nos deja con un extraño y ominoso "thriller" de ciencia ficción en el que es más importante pensar que disparar, la destreza que la fuerza bruta.

Portal es lo más cercano al juego perfecto que existe: la originalidad del planteamiento, los atmosféricos gráficos, el diseño de relojería de los niveles o el magnífico guión, cada apartado raya a una altura sorprendente y todos juntos crean una experiencia pocas veces conseguida en un videojuego.

Um simples dispositivo, e inúmeras possibilidades: é assim que Portal age enquanto você joga. A ideia de uso de portais é excelentemente bem feita aqui, e não poderia ser por menos: foi feito pela Valve. Ainda que ache que esse jogo seja apenas uma reciclagem de HL2, como jogabilidade (fora os portais, claro) ele é totalmente válido, e todos deveriam jogar. Mais ou menos curto, entretanto a dialogagem de GLaDOS com o jogador é simplesmente fascinante e bem feita. RECOMENDADÍSSMO.

I was really liking this game, but the game just sort of ends at level 19. You're told that you'll be getting cake, but all you do is get burned in fire. That's it. Friends even told me that it was worth playing this game for the song at the end of the game, but all I heard was the regular background music change to a heavier beat. That computer was lying to me the whole time, but I could never get revenge on it. I was hoping there was some way to make it through the fire and be still alive, but NOTHING.
Every steam user should have this in their collection.

Portal is where it all started. This basic puzzle game isn't just matching 3 colour rocks. Its more then that, its a thinking game - go through 19 chambers of fun and challenging tests. If you like thinking and cake. This game is for you.

The campaign is short but worth every bit, very nice the gameplay and truly entertaining the humour, it also offers some nice re-playability with challenges and advanced maps. A puzzle game made FPS o_O

Um dos melhores jogos single player que já joguei. É um FPS sem armas, apenas com uma máquina que cria portais. A moral do jogo é passar por diversas câmaras com diferentes quebra-cabeças para serem resolvidos. As vozes também são destaque, pois muitas falas são engraçadas e memoráveis. E o final tem uma das músicas mais divertidas já compostas para um jogo.

Well I have nothing but great things to say about this game. So I insist on pointing out that this game is better than the second, in one way. Why? Because in Portal 2 they tried to build too much on the A.I. having backstory and personality, when the perfect enemy is one that is unkown. In Portal 1 they captured this concept very well.
